{{Short description|First Lady of the Maldives, since 2023}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Saajidha Mohamed | image = [[File:Saajidha.png|thumb|right]] | caption = | office = [[First Lady of the Maldives]] | native_name = ސާޖިދާ މުހައްމަދު | termstart = 17 November 2023 | term_label = Assumed role | spouse = Mohamed muizzu | children = 3 | president = Mohamed muizzu | preceding = Fazna ahmed | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | honorific_prefix = Madam | succeeded = | term_end = }} '''Saajidha''' '''ސާޖިދާ މުހައްމަދު''' Is the wife of the president of the Maldives, Mohamed muizzu as of 2023. In their marriage they got 3 children. Saajidha mohamed and president muizzu's office palace is muliaage (palace) (henveyru gan'duvaru which was built by sultan Shamsuddeen lll of the Maldives for his son.

{{Short description|Maldivian politican}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific_prefix = Mayor | name = Ahmed Nareesh | native_name = {{nobold|އަހުމަދު ނަރީޝް}} | native_name_lang = dv | image = Ahmed Nareesh.jpg | caption = Ahmed Nareesh | office = [[Malé]] city mayor (interim) | status = Active | term_start = 17 November 2023 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | successor = | spouse = | children = }} '''Ahmed Nareesh''' is the Deputy Mayor of [[Malé]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ahmed Nareesh |url=https://malecity.gov.mv/en/council/2 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=Undercurrent News}}</ref> He is serving as the acting mayor, since former Mayor [[Mohamed Muizzu]] resigned On 17 November 2023.{{citation needed}}

revision.text:
{{Short description|Maldivian politican}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific_prefix = Mayor | name = Ahmed Nareesh | native_name = {{nobold|އަހުމަދު ނަރީޝް}} | native_name_lang = dv | image = | caption = | office = [[Malé]] city mayor (interim) | status = Active | term_start = 17 November 2023 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | successor = | spouse = | children = }} '''Ahmed Nareesh''' is the Deputy Mayor of [[Malé]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ahmed Nareesh |url=https://malecity.gov.mv/en/council/2 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=Undercurrent News}}</ref> He is serving as the acting mayor, since former Mayor [[Mohamed Muizzu]] resigned On 17 November 2023.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://raajje.mv/143174|title=By-election for Male' City mayor should be held before 17 January: Habeeb|website=raajje.mv}}</ref>
==Mayor of Malé City And Political Career== He was elected as the Deputy mayor on 21/6/2021. He was then-opposition [[Progressive Party of Maldives|PPM]]'s council Member. when Nareesh won the mayor elections, he was [[Maafannu]] Medhu Constituency member for [[People's Majlis]]. He Active in the [[Politics of the Maldives]] since He was a council Member of [[Progressive Party of Maldives]]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Nareesh, Ahmed}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

==Mayor of Malé City And Political Career== He was elected as the Deputy mayor on 21/6/2021.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title= Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of Malé |url=https://en.thepress.mv/13067 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= the press}}</ref> He was then-opposition [[Progressive Party of Maldives|PPM]]'s council Member. when Nareesh won the mayor elections, he was [[Maafannu]] Medhu Constituency member for [[People's Majlis]]. He Active in the [[Politics of the Maldives]] since He was a council Member of [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] <ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref> Nareesh, who formerly served in MNDF gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches.
==Early Life== Naresh was a presenter who hosted [[Maldives|Maldivian]] Famous two tv programs "Madiseela" & "Hajam" Which is a night tv program showed by "Chennel 13 News"<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref>
Nareesh was a Former MNDF gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches. <ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Deputy Mayor Nareesh to run for parliament |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/83365 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= one online}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Short description|Maldivian politican}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific_prefix = Mayor | name = Ahmed Nareesh | native_name = {{nobold|އަހުމަދު ނަރީޝް}} | native_name_lang = dv | image = Nareesh cropped image.jpg | caption = | office = [[Malé]] city mayor (interim) | status = Incumbent | term_start = 17 November 2023 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | successor = | office1 = Deputy Mayor of [[Malé]] | term_start1 = 21 June 2021 | status = Incumbent | spouse = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Kolamaafushi]] | children = }} '''Ahmed Nareesh''' ({{lang-dv|އަހުމަދު ނަރީޝް}}; is the Deputy Mayor of [[Malé]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ahmed Nareesh |url=https://malecity.gov.mv/en/council/2 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=malecity.gov.mv}}</ref> He is serving as the acting mayor, since former Mayor [[Mohamed Muizzu]] resigned On 17 November 2023. He is also serving as the Deputy Mayor of Malé<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://raajje.mv/143174|title=By-election for Male' City mayor should be held before 17 January: Habeeb|website=raajje.mv}}</ref>
==Mayor of Malé City And Political Career== He was elected as the Deputy mayor on 21 June 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title= Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of Malé |url=https://en.thepress.mv/13067 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= the press}}</ref> He was then-opposition [[Progressive Party of Maldives|PPM]]'s council Member. when Nareesh won the mayor elections, he was [[Maafannu]] Medhu Constituency member for [[People's Majlis]]. He is Active in the [[Politics of the Maldives]] since He was a council Member of [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] <ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref> Nareesh, who formerly served in MNDF gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches.
==Early Life== Nareesh was born on [[Kolamaafushi|Ga.Kolamaafushi]]. He was a presenter who hosted [[Maldives|Maldivian]] Famous two tv programs "Madiseela" & "Hajam" Which is a night tv program showed by "Chennel 13 News"<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref>
Nareesh was a Former MNDF gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches. <ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Deputy Mayor Nareesh to run for parliament |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/83365 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= one online}}</ref>

Nareesh represents [[Maafannu]] medhu constituency on the council. He is Active in the [[Politics of the Maldives]] since He was a council Member of [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] <ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref> Nareesh, who formerly served in MNDF gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches.
==Early Life== Nareesh was born on [[Kolamaafushi|Ga.Kolamaafushi]]. He was a tv presenter who hosted [[Maldives|Maldivian]] Famous two tv programs "Madiseela" & "Hajam" Which is a night tv program showed by "Chennel 13 News"<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref>
Nareesh was a Former MNDF gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches. <ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Deputy Mayor Nareesh to run for parliament |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/83365 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= one online}}</ref>

Nareesh was elected as the Deputy mayor on 21 June 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title= Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of Malé |url=https://en.thepress.mv/13067 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= the press}}</ref> He was then-opposition [[Progressive Party of Maldives|PPM]]'s council Member. Nareesh represents [[Maafannu]] medhu constituency on the council. He has been active in the [[politics of the Maldives]] since he was a Council Member of [[Progressive Party of Maldives]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref> Nareesh, who formerly served in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF), gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Deputy Mayor Nareesh to run for parliament |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/83365 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= one online}}</ref>

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific_prefix = | name = Ahmed Nareesh | native_name = {{nobold|އަހުމަދު ނަރީޝް}} | native_name_lang = dv | image = Malé_city_deputy_mayor_Ahmed_Nareesh.jpg | caption = | office = Deputy Mayor of [[Malé]] | status = | term_start = 21 June 2021 | 2blankname = Mayors | 2namedata = [[Mohamed Muizzu]], [[Adam Azim (Maldives) | Adam Azim]] | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]], [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | office1 = Acting Mayor of [[Malé]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2023 | term_end1 = 22 January 2024 | status1 = | deputy1 = {{small|Himself, as he is serving both mayor and deputy mayor (interim)}} | president1 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | successor1 = [[Adam Azim (politician) | Adam Azim]] | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] | spouse = | birth_date = 1988 | birth_place = [[Kolamaafushi]] | party = [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] | children = }} '''Ahmed Nareesh''' ({{lang-dv|އަހުމަދު ނަރީޝް}}; born 1988) is the Deputy Mayor of [[Malé]], the capital city of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ahmed Nareesh |url=https://malecity.gov.mv/en/council/2 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=malecity.gov.mv}}</ref> He was serving as the acting mayor, after the former Mayor [[Mohamed Muizzu]] resigned On 17 November 2023.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://raajje.mv/143174|title=By-election for Male' City mayor should be held before 17 January: Habeeb|website=raajje.mv}}</ref> After the mayoral elections in 2024, [[Adam Azim (Maldives)|Adam Azim]] became the new mayor.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Mohamed |first=Mariyath |date=13 January 2024 |title=Male' Mayoral Election: Azim wins by a large margin! |url=https://edition.mv/male_mayor/31003 |access-date=13 January 2024 |work=The Edition}}</ref>
== Career== Nareesh was a television presenter who hosted the [[Maldives|Maldivian]] nightly programs ''Madiseela'' and ''Hajam'' on Channel 13 News.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref>
Nareesh was elected as the Deputy mayor on 21 June 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title= Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of Malé |url=https://en.thepress.mv/13067 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= the press}}</ref> He was then-opposition [[Progressive Party of Maldives|PPM]]'s council Member. Nareesh represents [[Maafannu]] medhu constituency on the council. He has been active in the [[politics of the Maldives]] since he was a Council Member of [[Progressive Party of Maldives]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Opposition council member Ahmed Nareesh elected as the Deputy Mayor of the capital city. |url=https://maldivesnewsnetwork.com/2021/06/21/opposition-council-member-ahmed-nareesh-elected-as-the-deputy-mayor-of-the-capital-city/ |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= MNN}}</ref> Nareesh, who formerly served in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF), gained popularity in public after former president used his name to make an example during one of his public speeches.<ref>{{Cite web |date=27 November 2023 |title=Deputy Mayor Nareesh to run for parliament |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/83365 |access-date=5 December 2023 |website= one online}}</ref>
